intro: Triumfetta pilosa var. effusa, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. The species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
